bibl.title: Letter from Frank F. Law to Philip Showalter Hench, December 9, 1941

div1.p: Law is glad that Hench likes the two oil sketches of the "Cuban version" of Cornwell's yellow fever painting.

div1.head: Letter from Frank F. Law to Philip Showalter Hench, December 9, 1941
div1.opener:
1840
John Wyeth V Brother
Incorporated
Manufacturing Chemists,
Philadelphia
December 9, 1941
1600 Arch Street
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter of December 3. We are glad
that you like the two oil sketches of the Cuban version of the
yellow fever story and frankly, we don't know anyone to whom
we would prefer to give them than yourself, as we think you
have done more and know more about the conquest of yellow fever
than any other man in the country.

This covers a wide territory, but after hearing you
speak in Cleveland, we are convinced that you left nothing un-
done to get the truth of this conquest and the sketches there-
fore belong to an authority.

The American Medical Association meets in Atlantic City
this year and I should like you to reserve one day to have lunch
with me. This is purely personal and selfish, as my friends,
Mr. Willis and Mr. Bartlett have said if you ever come East they
would like to spend an hour or two with you.

I mention this now because I know you have a full calen-
dar at the Convention and I shall write you later to remind you
of the invitation.
